questions.question_text: A user receives a large custom report to track company sales across various date ranges. The user then completes a series of manual calculations for each date range. Which of the following should an analyst suggest so the user has a dynamic, seamless experience?

choices.C: Add macros to the report to speed up the filtering and calculations process.
choices.D: Create a dashboard with a date range picker and calculations built in.
choices.A: Create multiple reports, one for each needed date range.
choices.B: Build calculations into the report so they are done automatically.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is best answer

(D) A dashboard with a date range picker allows the user to select any desired date range easily, without the need for multiple reports or manual filtering. By building calculations directly into the dashboard, the user can avoid manual calculations for each date range

D.

A dashboard with a date range picker would allow the user to dynamically select the desired date range, and have the calculations done automatically without any manual effort. This would provide a seamless and dynamic experience for the user.
D. Redundant Data. Both columns would be communicating the same information (albeit, in different units).

questions.question_text: A table in a hospital database has a column for patient height in inches and a column for patient height in centimeters. This is an example of:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct, since there is no right pattern as an answer for the question!

Selected Answer: D
A or D will the answer
Why is A not a valid answer? Replace all the missing data with something like question not answered
D. If there is no data at all there, remove it

questions.question_text: While reviewing survey data, a research analyst notices data is missing from all the responses to a single question. Which of the following methods would BEST address this issue?

choices.D: A measure that is used to find the significant difference between variables
choices.C: A measure of the amount of dispersion of a set of values
choices.B: A measure of how data is distributed
choices.A: A measure that is used to establish a relationship between two variables

questions.question_text: Which of the following BEST describes standard deviation?

discussion.content: C. Standard Deviation measures the amount of dispersion of a set of values
two variables, possibly related = scatter plot

Selected Answer: B
B. A scatter plot would BEST represent the relationship between the variables of study hours and exam scores for each student. A scatter plot shows the relationship between two variables by plotting their values in a two-dimensional graph. Each data point in the scatter plot represents a student's study hours and exam score. The scatter plot allows the analyst to see if there is a positive or negative relationship between the variables, and if there is a linear or nonlinear relationship. It provides a visual representation of the data, making it easier to understand and interpret.

Selected Answer: B
B. A scatter plot
